data.enText: fitting
fitted
fitted
fitting
fit
fit

data.chText: 用于被动语态者除外
data.enText: except in the passive

data.chText: 恰当的大小 / 类型
data.enText: right size/type

data.chText: （形状和尺寸）适合，合身

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be the right shape and size for sb/sth

data.chText: 我试穿了那连衣裙，但不合身。
data.enText: I tried the dress on but it didn't fit.

data.chText: 那件短上衣很合身。
data.enText: That jacket fits well.

data.chText: 紧身连衣裙
data.enText: a close-fitting dress

data.chText: 我找不到合身的衣服。
data.enText: I can't find clothes to fit me.

data.chText: 这把钥匙打不开这把锁。
data.enText: The key doesn't fit the lock.

data.chText: （大小、式样、数量适合）可容纳，装进
data.enText: to be of the right size, type or number to go somewhere

data.chText: 我想在房间放一张桌子，但是搁不下。
data.enText: I'd like to have a desk in the room but it won't fit.

data.chText: 所有的孩子都可以坐到车的后排。
data.enText: All the kids will fit in the back of the car.

data.chText: 试穿（衣服）
data.enText: to put clothes on sb and make them the right size and shape

data.chText: 今天我要去试穿结婚礼服。
data.enText: I'm going to be fitted for my wedding dress today.

data.chText: 安置
data.enText: put sth somewhere

data.chText: 安置，安装（在某处）
data.enText: to put or fix sth somewhere

data.chText: 他们把烟雾报警器安装在天花板上。
data.enText: They fitted a smoke alarm to the ceiling.

data.chText: 所有的房间都安装了烟雾报警器。
data.enText: The rooms were all fitted with smoke alarms.

data.chText: 合上；盖上；组合；组装
data.enText: to put or join sth in the right place

data.chText: 这个玻璃杯放在大罐口上恰好当个盖子。
data.enText: The glass fits on top of the jug to form a lid.

data.chText: 这两部分如何拼在一起呢？
data.enText: How do these two parts fit together ?

data.chText: 我们把拼图玩具的各部分拼合在了一起。
data.enText: We fitted together the pieces of the puzzle.

data.chText: 一致；相称
data.enText: agree/match

data.chText: （使）与…一致，和…相称，符合

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to agree with, match or be suitable for sth; to make sth do this

data.chText: 这里有点不大协调。
data.enText: Something doesn't quite fit here.

data.chText: 他的画哪一类也算不上。
data.enText: His pictures don't fit into any category.

data.chText: 这些事实和你的说法丝毫不差。
data.enText: The facts certainly fit your theory.

data.chText: 罚需当罪。
data.enText: The punishment ought to fit the crime.

data.chText: 我们应该根据罪行量刑。
data.enText: We should fit the punishment to the crime.

data.chText: 使适合
data.enText: make suitable

data.chText: 使适合，使胜任（某工作）
data.enText: to make sb/sth suitable for a particular job

data.chText: 他的经验使他完全胜任这项工作。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: His experience fitted him perfectly for the job.

data.chText: 他的经验使他适合干这个工作。
data.enText: His experience fitted him to do the job.
fit (sb) like a glove

data.chText: （大小、形状）完全合适，恰好合身
data.enText: to be the perfect size or shape for sb
fill/fit the bill

data.chText: 符合要求；合格
data.enText: to be what is needed in a particular situation or for a particular purpose

data.chText: 从书面材料看，有几位申请人符合条件。
data.enText: On paper, several of the applicants fit the bill.
if the cap fits (, wear it)
if the shoe fits (, wear it)

data.chText: 有则改之
data.enText: if you feel that a remark applies to you, you should accept it and take it as a warning or criticism

data.chText: 我并没有真的说你懒，但有则改之。
data.enText: I didn't actually say that you were lazy, but if the cap fits…
sb's face doesn't fit

data.chText: 长相不合格；性格不合适
data.enText: used to say that sb will not get a particular job or position because they do not have the appearance, personality, etc. that the employer wants, even when this should not be important

data.chText: 资历多好也没用，如果人家看你不对眼，你就不会有机会。
data.enText: It doesn't matter how well qualified you are, if your face doesn't fit, you don't stand a chance.
fit sb/sth↔in
fit sb/sth in/into sth

data.chText: 找到时间（见某人、做某事）
data.enText: to find time to see sb or to do sth

data.chText: 我尽量午饭后抽时间见你。
data.enText: I'll try and fit you in after lunch.

data.chText: 我得在一个上午安排十个约见。
data.enText: I had to fit ten appointments into one morning.

data.chText: 找到足够的地方；有足够空间
data.enText: to find or have enough space for sb/sth in a place

data.chText: 我们没有地方再摆更多的椅子了。
data.enText: We can't fit in any more chairs.
fit in (with sb/sth)

data.chText: （与…）合得来；适应
data.enText: to live, work, etc. in an easy and natural way with sb/sth

data.chText: 他过去从未干过这种工作，很难说他是否会与其他人配合得好。
data.enText: He's never done this type of work before; I'm not sure how he'll fit in with the other people.

data.chText: 哪里有我适合的地方？
data.enText: Where do I fit in?

data.chText: 这些计划和你的安排冲突吗？
data.enText: Do these plans fit in with your arrangements?
fit sb/sth↔out/up (with sth)

data.chText: 向…提供所需的东西（如装备、设备、衣服、粮食等）
data.enText: to supply sb/sth with all the equipment, clothes, food, etc. they need

data.chText: 给要远航的轮船提供必需品
data.enText: to fit out a ship before a long voyage

data.chText: 这个房间安装有炉子和洗涤槽。
data.enText: The room has been fitted out with a stove and a sink.
fit sb↔up (for sth)

data.chText: 诬陷某人（犯罪）
data.enText: to make it look as if sb is guilty of a crime they have not committed

data.chText: 这事不是我干的——我遭到诬陷了！
data.enText: I didn't do it─I've been fitted up!
fitter
fittest

data.chText: 健康
data.enText: healthy

data.chText: 健壮的；健康的
data.enText: healthy and strong, especially because you do regular physical exercise

data.chText: 顶级运动员体格必须十分健壮。
data.enText: Top athletes have to be very fit.

data.chText: 他身体不适，不能在星期六出场比赛。
data.enText: He won't be fit to play in the match on Saturday.

data.chText: 她每天慢跑以保持健康。
data.enText: She tries to keep fit by jogging every day.

data.chText: 他得了重感冒，还不能上班。
data.enText: He's had a bad cold and isn't fit enough for work yet.

data.chText: 我觉得十分健康，精力充沛。
data.enText: I feel really fighting fit (= very healthy and full of energy) .

data.chText: 政府旨在使英国的工业更加简而精。
data.enText: The government aims to make British industry leaner and fitter (= employing fewer people and with lower costs) .

data.chText: 合适
data.enText: suitable

data.chText: （质量、素质或技能）适合的，恰当的，合格的
data.enText: suitable; of the right quality; with the right qualities or skills

data.chText: 这食物不适合人吃。
data.enText: The food was not fit for human consumption.

data.chText: 这饭菜够得上御膳。
data.enText: It was a meal fit for a king (= of very good quality) .

data.chText: 你的车子还不适合上马路！
data.enText: Your car isn't fit to be on the road!

data.chText: 孩子们似乎以为我只配做饭洗衣！
data.enText: The children seem to think I'm only fit for cooking and washing!

data.chText: 他气成这个样子，简直无法见人。
data.enText: He's so angry he's in no fit state to see anyone.

data.chText: 这个地方不适合你居住。
data.enText: This is not a fit place for you to live.

data.chText: 准备好
data.enText: ready

data.chText: 可能（或准备）做某事至极端程度
data.enText: ready or likely to do sth extreme

data.chText: 他们一直工作到快要累趴下了。
data.enText: They worked until they were fit to drop (= so tired that they were likely to fall down) .

data.chText: 我吃得太多，肚子快要撑破了。
data.enText: I've eaten so much I'm fit to burst .

data.chText: 她笑得肚子都要破了。
data.enText: She was laughing fit to burst (= very much) .

data.chText: 诱人
data.enText: attractive

data.chText: 性感迷人的
data.enText: sexually attractive
(as) fit as a fiddle

data.chText: 非常健康
data.enText: in very good physical condition
see/think fit (to do sth)

data.chText: 认为（做某事）恰当（或适合）；决定，愿意（做某事）
data.enText: to consider it right or acceptable to do sth; to decide or choose to do sth

data.chText: 你认为怎么合适就怎么干（但我不同意你的决定）。
data.enText: You must do as you think fit (= but I don't agree with your decision) .

data.chText: 那份报纸认为我的信件不宜发表（而我批评这种看法）。
data.enText: The newspaper did not see fit to publish my letter (= and I criticize it for that) .
the survival of the fittest

data.chText: 适者生存
data.enText: the principle that only the people or things that are best adapted to their surroundings will continue to exist

data.chText: 疾病
data.enText: illness

data.chText: （癫痫等的）突发，发作；昏厥；痉挛
data.enText: a sudden attack of an illness, such as epilepsy , in which sb becomes unconscious and their body may make violent movements

data.chText: 癫痫发作
data.enText: to have an epileptic fit

data.chText: 她的病现已用药物控制，没有发作。
data.enText: Her fits are now controlled by drugs.

data.chText: 咳嗽；笑
data.enText: of coughing/laughter

data.chText: 一阵（忍不住的咳嗽、笑）
data.enText: a sudden short period of coughing or of laughing, that you cannot control

data.chText: 一阵咳嗽
data.enText: a fit of coughing

data.chText: 他的笑话使我们都笑得前仰后合。
data.enText: He had us all in fits (of laughter) with his jokes.

data.chText: 强烈感情
data.enText: of strong feeling

data.chText: （强烈感情）发作，冲动
data.enText: a short period of very strong feeling

data.chText: 一阵愤怒 / 狂怒 / 怒火 / 恼怒之下采取行动
data.enText: to act in a fit of anger/rage/temper/pique

data.chText: 衣服
data.enText: of clothing

data.chText: （尤指衣服）适合，合身
data.enText: the way that sth, especially a piece of clothing, fits

data.chText: 很 / 不合身；贴身；完全合身
data.enText: a good/bad/close/perfect fit

data.chText: 匹配
data.enText: match

data.chText: 匹配；相配
data.enText: the way that two things match each other or are suitable for each other

data.chText: 我们必须算出所需人员与现有人员之间的最佳搭配。
data.enText: We need to work out the best fit between the staff required and the staff available.
by/in fits and starts

data.chText: 间歇地；一阵一阵地
data.enText: frequently starting and stopping again; not continuously

data.chText: 由于还承担着其他任务，我只能断断续续地写书。
data.enText: Because of other commitments I can only write my book in fits and starts.
have/throw a fit

data.chText: 大为震惊；非常心烦意乱；大发脾气
data.enText: to be very shocked, upset or angry

data.chText: 要是你母亲知道你一直喝酒，会很生气的！
data.enText: Your mother would have a fit if she knew you'd been drinking!

data.text: well ♦ all right ♦ OK ♦ fine ♦ healthy ♦ strong ♦ fit

data.chText: 以上各词均形容人健康、身体好。
data.enText: These words all describe sb who is not ill and is in good health.
well

data.chText: 指健康、身体好：
data.enText: [not usually before noun] ( rather informal ) in good health

data.chText: 我感觉身体不太好。
data.enText: I'm not feeling very well.

data.chText: 他身体怎么样，能够旅行吗？
data.enText: Is he well enough to travel?

data.chText: well尤用以谈自己的健康、询问别人的健康或评价身体情况。
data.enText: Well is used especially to talk about your own health, to ask sb about their health or to make a comment on it.
all right

data.chText: 指感觉身体还好、没有生病、没有受伤：
data.enText: [not before noun] ( rather informal ) not feeling ill; not injured

data.chText: 你感觉还好吗？
data.enText: Are you feeling all right?
OK

data.chText: 指感觉身体还好、没有生病、没有受伤：
data.enText: [not before noun] ( informal ) not feeling ill; not injured

data.chText: 她说她现在身体还可以，明天就回来上班。
data.enText: She says she's OK now, and will be back at work tomorrow.

data.chText: 用all right还是OK？
上述两词比同组其他词的肯定含意稍弱一些，两词均用于英语口语中，指没有生病、安然无恙，而非确定身体健康；两词均相当非正式，不过OK较all right还要非正式些。
data.enText: These words are slightly less positive than the other words in this group. They are both used in spoken English to talk about not actually being ill or injured, rather than being positively in good health. Both are rather informal but OK is slightly more informal than all right .
all right or ok?
fine

data.chText: （不用于否定句）指身体很好、健康：
data.enText: [not before noun] (not used in negative statements) ( rather informal ) completely well

data.chText: “你好吗？”“很好，谢谢。”
data.enText: ‘How are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks.’

data.chText: fine尤用于回应别人的询问，表示自己身体很健康；与人谈话时，亦可用以指另一人身体健康。与well不一样，fine通常不用于询问别人的身体状况或者谈论身体情况：
data.enText: Fine is used especially to talk about your health, especially when sb asks you how you are. It is also used to talk about sb's health when you are talking to sb else. Unlike well it is not often used to ask sb about their health or make a comment on it.
Are you keeping fine?
healthy

data.chText: 指健康、健壮：
data.enText: in good health and not likely to become ill

data.chText: 经常锻炼以保持健康。
data.enText: Keep healthy by exercising regularly.
strong

data.chText: 指健康、身体好：
data.enText: in good health and not suffering from an illness

data.chText: 几周之后她感觉好些了。
data.enText: After a few weeks she was feeling stronger.

data.chText: strong常用以指病后恢复健康。
data.enText: Strong is often used to talk about becoming healthy again after an illness.
fit

data.chText: 指健壮，尤指因经常锻炼而身体健康：
data.enText: ( especially BrE ) in good physical health, especially because you take regular physical exercise

data.chText: 我每天游泳以保持健康。
data.enText: I go swimming every day in order to keep fit.
all right/OK/fit for sth
all right/OK/fit to do sth
to be/seem/look/feel well/all right/OK/fine/healthy/strong/fit
to keep (sb) well/healthy/strong/fit
a healthy/fit man/woman
perfectly/completely well/all right/OK/fine/healthy/strong/fit
very/extremely/quite/fairly well/healthy/strong/fit
physically well/fine/healthy/strong/fit
fit and well

word_means: 可能做某事至极端程度

means: 可能(或准备)做某事至极端程度

ex.enText: The food is not fit for consumption.

ex.chText: 他们认为我只配做饭洗衣。
ex.enText: They think I'm only fit for cooking and washing.

ex.chText: 他不适合主持这次会议。
ex.enText: He is not fit to preside over this meeting.
That wine is not fit to drink.
He is not fit to be a teacher.
This cellar is not fit for human habitation.

synonyms.bx: 指在质量、素质、技能等方面适合做某事的，常后接介词 for 或动词不定式。

ex.chText: 很难找到一个适合野餐的地方。
ex.enText: It is difficult to find a place suitable for a picnic.

ex.chText: 这个时间不适合给他打电话。
ex.enText: This is not a suitable time to call him.

ex.chText: 她没有其他适合在聚会上穿的裙子。
ex.enText: She had no other dress suitable to wear for the party.

synonyms.bx: 指对于某个人、某种情况或某一目的而言具备合适特性的，常后接介词 for 或动词不定式。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：适合的，适当的

data.enText: fit (sb) like a glove

data.chText: （大小、形状）完全合适，恰好合身
data.enText: to be the perfect size or shape for sb
fill/fit the bill

data.chText: 符合要求；合格
data.enText: to be what is needed in a particular situation or for a particular purpose

data.chText: 从书面材料看，有几位申请人符合条件。
data.enText: On paper, several of the applicants fit the bill.
if the cap fits (, wear it)
if the shoe fits (, wear it)

data.chText: 有则改之
data.enText: if you feel that a remark applies to you, you should accept it and take it as a warning or criticism

data.chText: 我并没有真的说你懒，但有则改之。
data.enText: I didn't actually say that you were lazy, but if the cap fits…
answer/fit a description (of sb/sth)

data.chText: 与描述的…相像
data.enText: to be like a particular person or thing

data.chText: 昨天在伦敦发现了一个与失踪男孩情况相符的孩子，安然无恙。
data.enText: A child answering the description of the missing boy was found safe and well in London yesterday.
sb's face doesn't fit

data.chText: 长相不合格；性格不合适
data.enText: used to say that sb will not get a particular job or position because they do not have the appearance, personality, etc. that the employer wants, even when this should not be important

data.chText: 资历多好也没用，如果人家看你不对眼，你就不会有机会。
data.enText: It doesn't matter how well qualified you are, if your face doesn't fit, you don't stand a chance.
(as) fit as a fiddle

data.chText: 非常健康
data.enText: in very good physical condition
see/think fit (to do sth)

data.chText: 认为（做某事）恰当（或适合）；决定，愿意（做某事）
data.enText: to consider it right or acceptable to do sth; to decide or choose to do sth

data.chText: 你认为怎么合适就怎么干（但我不同意你的决定）。
data.enText: You must do as you think fit (= but I don't agree with your decision) .

data.chText: 那份报纸认为我的信件不宜发表（而我批评这种看法）。
data.enText: The newspaper did not see fit to publish my letter (= and I criticize it for that) .
the survival of the fittest

data.chText: 适者生存
data.enText: the principle that only the people or things that are best adapted to their surroundings will continue to exist
by/in fits and starts

data.chText: 间歇地；一阵一阵地
data.enText: frequently starting and stopping again; not continuously

data.chText: 由于还承担着其他任务，我只能断断续续地写书。
data.enText: Because of other commitments I can only write my book in fits and starts.
have/throw a fit

data.chText: 大为震惊；非常心烦意乱；大发脾气
data.enText: to be very shocked, upset or angry

data.chText: 要是你母亲知道你一直喝酒，会很生气的！
data.enText: Your mother would have a fit if she knew you'd been drinking!
fit sb/sth↔in
fit sb/sth in/into sth

data.chText: 找到时间（见某人、做某事）
data.enText: to find time to see sb or to do sth

data.chText: 我尽量午饭后抽时间见你。
data.enText: I'll try and fit you in after lunch.

data.chText: 我得在一个上午安排十个约见。
data.enText: I had to fit ten appointments into one morning.

data.chText: 找到足够的地方；有足够空间
data.enText: to find or have enough space for sb/sth in a place

data.chText: 我们没有地方再摆更多的椅子了。
data.enText: We can't fit in any more chairs.
fit in (with sb/sth)

data.chText: （与…）合得来；适应
data.enText: to live, work, etc. in an easy and natural way with sb/sth

data.chText: 他过去从未干过这种工作，很难说他是否会与其他人配合得好。
data.enText: He's never done this type of work before; I'm not sure how he'll fit in with the other people.

data.chText: 哪里有我适合的地方？
data.enText: Where do I fit in?

data.chText: 这些计划和你的安排冲突吗？
data.enText: Do these plans fit in with your arrangements?
fit sb/sth↔out/up (with sth)

data.chText: 向…提供所需的东西（如装备、设备、衣服、粮食等）
data.enText: to supply sb/sth with all the equipment, clothes, food, etc. they need

data.chText: 给要远航的轮船提供必需品
data.enText: to fit out a ship before a long voyage

data.chText: 这个房间安装有炉子和洗涤槽。
data.enText: The room has been fitted out with a stove and a sink.
fit sb↔up (for sth)

data.chText: 诬陷某人（犯罪）
data.enText: to make it look as if sb is guilty of a crime they have not committed

data.chText: 这事不是我干的——我遭到诬陷了！
data.enText: I didn't do it─I've been fitted up!

trans: 找到时间（见某人）；安排时间（做某事）
（在特定情形或体系中）发挥作用；适合；符合
归属，适于（特定情形或体系）

tr: a sudden flurry of activity (often for no obvious reason)
the manner in which something fits
example: I admired the fit of her coat

tr: insert or adjust several objects or people
example: Can you fit the toy into the box?
This man can't fit himself into our work environment
He fitted other pieces of paper to his cut-out

tr: provide with (something) usually for a specific purpose
example: The expedition was equipped with proper clothing, food, and other necessities
The two stories don't agree in many details
The handwriting checks with the signature on the check
The suspect's fingerprints don't match those on the gun

tr: be the right size or shape
example: This piece won't fit into the puzzle
Does this paper meet the requirements for the degree?

tr: conform to some shape or size
physically and mentally sound or healthy
example: felt relaxed and fit after their holiday
keeps fit with diet and exercise

tr: meeting adequate standards for a purpose
example: it is fit and proper that you be there
do as you see fit to

value.boxr_value: In American English the form fit is used in the present tense and sometimes also as the past tense and past participle of the verb. 美国英语中fit用作现在时，有时也用作过去式和过去分词。

value.def: If something fits, it is the right size and shape to go onto a person's body or onto a particular object.

example.ex: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child...
example.tran: 腰带、和服和其他衣服都是儿童款的。

example.ex: She has to go to the men's department to find trousers that fit at the waist...
example.tran: 她得去男装部找一条腰围合适的裤子。

example.ex: Line a tin with lightly-greased greaseproof paper, making sure the corners fit well.
example.tran: 把稍稍上油的防油纸衬在罐子内部，确保各角都铺平整。

value.def: If something is a good fit, it fits well.

example.ex: Eventually he was happy that the sills and doors were a reasonably good fit.
example.tran: 门槛和门扇算是贴合良好，他终于开心了。

value.boxu_tran: 某物穿在某人身上或放在某处好看，不能用 fit 表示，而应用 suit。例如，It is really feminine and pretty and it certainly suits you(这件衣服很有女人味，又很漂亮，你穿着肯定好看)。动词 fit 则表示衣服尺码合适。例如，The size 12 gown was gorgeous and fitted perfectly(这件 12 码的礼服非常漂亮，而且大小正合适)，The gloves didn't fit(手套大小不合适)。suit 通常不能用来表示色彩、图案或物件互相匹配，应用动词 match。例如，She wears a straw hat with a yellow ribbon to match her yellow cheesecloth dress (她戴着一顶系有黄丝带的草帽，和她那件黄色薄棉纱连衣裙正好搭配), His clothes don't quite match (他的衣服不太搭)。
value.boxu_usage: You do not use the verb fit to say that something looks attractive on a person or in a place. The verb you need is suit. It is really feminine and pretty and it certainly suits you. You use the verb fit to say that clothes are the right size for you. The size 12 gown was gorgeous and fitted perfectly... The gloves didn't fit. You cannot usually say that one colour, pattern, or object suits another. The verb you need is match. She wears a straw hat with a yellow ribbon to match her yellow cheesecloth dress... His clothes don't quite match.

value.def: If you are fitted for a particular piece of clothing, you try it on so that the person who is making it can see where it needs to be altered.

example.ex: She was being fitted for her wedding dress.
example.tran: 她正在试穿婚纱。

value.def: If something fits somewhere, it can be put there or is designed to be put there.

example.ex: ...a pocket computer which is small enough to fit into your pocket...
example.tran: 小得能够放进衣袋里的袖珍电脑

example.ex: He folded his long legs to fit under the table...
example.tran: 他把两条长腿蜷起来伸进桌下。

example.ex: The crowd was too large to fit inside the hall.
example.tran: 人太多了，大厅里容不下。

example.ex: ...filters are available that fit over the lens of suitable cameras.
example.tran: 现有可以安在合适相机镜头上的滤镜。

value.tran: 适合放置(于);为放置(于…)而设计

value.def: If you fit something into a particular space or place, you put it there.

example.ex: She fitted her key in the lock...
example.tran: 她把钥匙插进锁孔。

example.ex: Who could cut the millions of stone blocks and fit them together?...
example.tran: 谁能切割出这数百万块的石块，再把它们堆叠起来呢？

example.ex: When the crown has been made you go back and the dentist will fit it into place.
example.tran: 人造牙冠做好后再去，牙医会把它安上。

value.def: If you fit something somewhere, you attach it there, or put it there carefully and securely.

example.ex: Fit hinge bolts to give extra support to the door lock...
example.tran: 安上铰链插销，让门锁更牢靠。

example.ex: Peter had built the overhead ladders, and the next day he fitted them to the wall...
example.tran: 彼得已经搭好了攀爬横梯，第二天便把它们安在了墙上。

example.ex: Home spas or mini whirlpools massage and relax, and can be fitted into the bath.
example.tran: 家庭热水澡桶或是小型涡流浴缸能够按摩并放松身体，可以安装在浴室中。

value.def: If something fits something else or fits into it, it goes together well with that thing or is able to be part of it.

example.ex: Her daughter doesn't fit the current feminine ideal...
example.tran: 她女儿并不符合当今的完美女性标准。

example.ex: Fostering is a full-time job and you should carefully consider how it will fit into your career...
example.tran: 抚养孩子是全天候的事，应该仔细考虑如何将它与事业协调起来。

example.ex: There's something about the way he talks of her that doesn't fit.
example.tran: 他谈论她的样子有点不对劲。

value.def: You can say that something fits a particular person or thing when it is appropriate or suitable for them or it.

example.ex: The punishment must always fit the crime.
example.tran: 必须始终坚持罪罚相当的原则。

value.def: If something is fit for a particular purpose, it is suitable for that purpose.

example.ex: Of the seven bicycles we had, only two were fit for the road.
example.tran: 我们的7辆自行车中，只有两辆适合走这种路。

example.ex: ...safety measures intended to reassure consumers that the meat is fit to eat...
example.tran: 旨在让消费者放心食用这些肉的安全措施

example.ex: Follow our guide to making your home a fit place to work, rest and play.
example.tran: 按照我们的指南把家营造成适合工作、休息和娱乐的地方。

gramarinfo.label: oft ADJ <l>for</l> n, ADJ to-inf, ADJ n to-inf, ADJ n <l>for</l> n

value.def: If someone is fit to do something, they have the appropriate qualities or skills that will allow them to do it.

example.ex: You're not fit to be a mother!...
example.tran: 你不配做母亲！

example.ex: In a word, this government isn't fit to rule...
example.tran: 简言之，这届政府无法胜任治国之责。

example.ex: I'm over 60 now and only fit for gardening and sleeping in a chair...
example.tran: 我已过花甲，只能侍弄侍弄花草，躺在椅子上睡会儿觉了。

example.ex: He was not a fit companion for their skipper that particular morning.
example.tran: 那天早晨，他没能和队长配合好。

gramarinfo.label: oft ADJ to-inf, ADJ <l>for</l> n, ADJ n <l>for</l> n, ADJ n to-inf

example.ex: There is a debate about his fitness for the highest office...
example.tran: 针对他是否能胜任最高职务展开了争论。

example.ex: If you have suffered from a serious medical condition, then you should consult your doctor about your fitness to travel.
example.tran: 如果患有严重疾病，就应向医生咨询是否适合旅行。

value.def: If something fits someone for a particular task or role, it makes them good enough or suitable for it.

example.ex: ...a man whose past experience fits him for the top job in education...
example.tran: 一个资历丰富、适合担任教育界最高职位的人

example.ex: It is not a person's gender that fits them to be a vicar but what is in their hearts.
example.tran: 一个人是否胜任教区牧师一职取决于其品德而不是其性别。

value.def: If you describe someone as fit, you mean that they are good-looking.

example.ex: About an hour later a really fit guy came up to me on the dance floor.
example.tran: 大概过了一个小时，一个长相非常俊美的男人在舞池里向我走过来。

value.def: If you say that something or someone is fit to produce some extreme result, you are emphasizing the extreme nature of that thing or that person's activity.

example.ex: The stink was fit to knock you down.
example.tran: 这臭味简直要把人熏倒。

example.ex: ...hour after hour, the same exercises until you're fit to drop!
example.tran: 一小时又一小时地做着同一套动作，直到快要晕倒！

example.ex: Wally was laughing fit to burst...
example.tran: 沃利快要笑破肚皮了。

example.ex: You're shivering fit to die, Gracie.
example.tran: 你抖得很厉害，格雷西。

value.def: If you say that someone sees fit to do something, you mean that they are entitled to do it, but that you disapprove of their decision to do it.

example.ex: He's not a friend, you say, yet you saw fit to lend him money.
example.tran: 你说他不是朋友，但你却决定借钱给他。

value.tran: (表示不赞成)决定，选择，认为做…合适

value.def: If you manage to fit a person or task in, you manage to find time to deal with them.

example.ex: We work long hours both outside and inside the home and we rush around trying to fit everything in...
example.tran: 我们家里家外长时间忙活，忙完这里忙那里，想把一切都搞定。

example.ex: I find that I just can't fit in regular domestic work.
example.tran: 我发现我真的没有时间做日常家务。

value.tran: 找到时间(见某人);安排时间(做某事)

value.def: If you fit in as part of a group, you seem to belong there because you are similar to the other people in it.

example.ex: She was great with the children and fitted in beautifully.
example.tran: 她和孩子们打交道很有一手,相处得十分融洽。

value.def: If you say that someone or something fits in, you understand how they form part of a particular situation or system.

example.ex: He knew where I fitted in and what he had to do to get the best out of me...
example.tran: 他知道我适合做什么，也知道他要怎么做才能让我发挥出最佳水平。

example.ex: This fits in with what you've told me.
example.tran: 这与你告诉过我的相符。

value.tran: (在某种情形或体系中)发挥作用，担当职责;适合;符合

value.def: If you fit into a particular group, you seem to belong there because you are similar to the other people in it.

example.ex: It's hard to see how he would fit into the team.
example.tran: 很难看出他将如何融入这支队伍。

value.tran: 融入;与…相处融洽(或和谐)

value.def: If something fits into a particular situation or system, that seems to be the right place for it.

example.ex: Most film locations broadly fit into two categories; those on private property and those in a public place.
example.tran: 多数电影的拍摄场地大致归为两类：私人宅院与公共场地。

value.tran: 归属，适于(某种情形或体系)

value.def: If you fit someone or something out, or you fit them up, you provide them with equipment and other things that they need.

example.ex: We helped to fit him out for a trip to the Baltic...
example.tran: 我们帮他准备了去波罗的海的行装。

example.ex: I suggest we fit you up with an office suite...
example.tran: 我建议我们给你配备一间办公套房。

example.ex: They spent 18 million pounds of Government funds fitting out the London headquarters.
example.tran: 他们花费了1,800万英镑的政府基金将伦敦总部的设施配备齐全。

value.tran: 为…提供装备;供给…必要的东西

value.def: If someone fits another person up, they try to make it seem that that person is responsible for a crime.

example.ex: Mr Stone said inmates who had given evidence were trying to 'fit him up'...
example.tran: 斯通先生说那些提供证据的同狱犯人是在试图“诬陷他”。

example.ex: There can never be any legitimate basis for police officers to fit up suspects they 'know' to be guilty.
example.tran: 警官诬陷那些他们“知道”犯了罪的嫌疑人是根本没有任何法律依据的。

menus.item: BEING RIGHT OR GOING IN THE RIGHT PLACE

value.def: Someone who is fit is healthy and physically strong.

example.ex: An averagely fit person can master easy ski runs within a few days.
example.tran: 健康的普通人几天内就可以掌握简单的滑雪技术。

example.ex: ...women who regularly engage in sports and fitness activities...
example.tran: 经常参加体育锻炼和健身活动的女性

example.ex: Squash was once thought to offer all-round fitness.
example.tran: 人们曾一度认为打壁球可以进行全身性锻炼。

value.def: If someone has a fit they suddenly lose consciousness and their body makes uncontrollable movements.

example.ex: About two in every five epileptic fits occur during sleep...
example.tran: 每5例癫痫病中约有两例是在睡眠过程中发作的。

example.ex: Once a fit has started there is nothing you can do to stop it.
example.tran: 痉挛一旦发作就无法止住。

value.def: If you have a fit of coughing or laughter, you suddenly start coughing or laughing in an uncontrollable way.

example.ex: Halfway down the cigarette she had a fit of coughing...
example.tran: 烟抽到一半，她突然一阵猛咳。

example.ex: It was so unreal that I broke into a fit of giggles.
example.tran: 这实在很离奇,我忍不住咯咯笑了起来。

value.tran: (突然止不住的)一阵(咳嗽、大笑)

value.def: If you do something in a fit of anger or panic, you are very angry or afraid when you do it.

example.ex: Pattie shot Tom in a fit of jealous rage.
example.tran: 帕蒂妒火中烧，开枪击中了汤姆。

value.def: If you say that someone will have a fit when they hear about something, you mean that they will be very angry or shocked.

example.ex: Will Mrs Winterton have a fit if we add one more to the guest list at this late stage?...
example.tran: 到这么晚的时候我们再增加一个客人，温特顿太太会发火吗？

example.ex: He'd have a fit if he knew what we were up to!
example.tran: 要是他知道我们在干什么会气疯了的。

value.tran: 大发雷霆;大光其火;大吃一惊

value.def: Someone who is in fits is laughing uncontrollably.

example.ex: He was a much more entertaining person, who used to have us all in fits.
example.tran: 他以前更为风趣，常常让我们大家都捧腹大笑。

value.def: Something that happens in fits and starts or by fits and starts keeps happening and then stopping again.

example.ex: My slimming attempts tend to go in fits and starts...
example.tran: 我的瘦身运动总是三天打鱼两天晒网。

example.ex: Military technology advances by fits and starts.
example.tran: 军事技术总是间断性地进步着。

menus.tran: 无法控制的行动或情感

trans: 使胜任某事，使适应(或适合)某事
给……量尺寸以便做……；适于，适合
适应；适合；符合；找到时间（见某人）；安排时间（做某事）；相处融洽；（在特定情形或体系中）发挥作用
融入；与…相处融洽；归属，适于（特定情形或体系）
静配合；压配合；干涉配合；公盈配合
紧配合；密配合；打入配合
